recipes.name: Chicken and Vegetable Casserole
instructions: Season chicken with salt, pepper, and thyme.
Heat oil in a large casserole dish, brown chicken pieces on all sides. Remove and set aside.
Add onions, carrots, and celery to the dish. Cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Sprinkle flour over vegetables, stir well.
Add potatoes and stock, bring to a simmer.
Return chicken to the dish, cover with lid.
Bake for 75 minutes until chicken is tender and sauce has thickened.
Let cool slightly before serving or freezing portions.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of white wine when making the sauce for extra depth.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes brilliantly for up to 3 months. Perfect for batch cooking.
recipes.childFriendly: Perfect for children! Mild flavors and soft textures. Cut chicken into small pieces for them.

recipes.name: Classic Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Heat a large pan over medium-high heat. Add mince and cook until browned, breaking up with a spoon.
Add onion, garlic, and carrots. Cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato purée and cook for 1 minute.
Add tinned tomatoes, stock, and oregano. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile, cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
Serve bolognese over spaghetti with grated cheese.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of red wine with the tomatoes for a richer sauce.
recipes.storageNotes: Freeze the sauce (without pasta) in portions for up to 3 months.
recipes.childFriendly: Children love this! The grated carrots add hidden veg. Cut the spaghetti into shorter pieces for easier eating.

recipes.name: Homemade Fish Fingers with Chips
ingredients: 400g white fish fillets (cod or haddock, Aldi)
instructions: Toss potato chips with 1 tbsp oil and spread on a baking tray. Bake for 30 minutes.
Set up three bowls: flour in one, beaten eggs in another, breadcrumbs in the third.
Coat each fish piece in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs.
Place on a lined baking tray, drizzle with remaining oil.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until golden and cooked through.
recipes.adultsVariation: Serve with tartar sauce and malt vinegar.
recipes.storageNotes: Fish fingers can be frozen uncooked. Cook from frozen, adding 5 minutes to cooking time.
recipes.childFriendly: Total winner with children! Much healthier than shop-bought versions.

recipes.name: Quick Chicken Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat oil in a large wok or frying pan over high heat.
Add chicken and stir-fry for 5-6 minutes until cooked through.
Add garlic and vegetables, stir-fry for 4-5 minutes.
Mix soy sauce and honey, pour over the stir-fry.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add chili flakes or sriracha for a kick.
recipes.storageNotes: Best eaten fresh, but leftovers keep for 2 days in the fridge.
recipes.childFriendly: Great for children! Mild and slightly sweet. Cut chicken into tiny pieces.

recipes.name: Family Beef Chili
ingredients: 1 tbsp mild chili powder (reduce for Ava)
Rice or jacket potatoes to serve
instructions: Brown the mince in a large pot, breaking it up as it cooks.
Add onions and garlic, cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in chili powder, cumin, and tomato purée. Cook for 1 minute.
Add tinned tomatoes and stock. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 40 minutes.
Add kidney beans, simmer for 10 more minutes.
Serve with rice or jacket potatoes.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add extra chili, jalapeños, or hot sauce to adult portions.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes perfectly for up to 3 months.
recipes.childFriendly: Keep children's portion mild - use less chili powder in her serving. They like it with rice.

recipes.name: Creamy Salmon Pasta
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Add peas for the last 3 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a pan. Season salmon and cook skin-side down for 4 minutes.
Flip and cook for 3 more minutes. Remove from pan and flake into chunks.
In the same pan, add garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Add crème fraîche, lemon juice, and zest. Warm through.
Drain pasta and peas, add to the sauce with salmon.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add capers or a splash of white wine to the sauce.
recipes.storageNotes: Best eaten fresh. Leftovers keep for 1 day.
recipes.childFriendly: children enjoys this! Make sure to remove any bones and check the salmon carefully.

recipes.name: Traditional Cottage Pie
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and mash with butter and milk.
Brown mince in a large pan. Add onion and carrots, cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato purée, cook for 1 minute.
Add stock and Worcestershire sauce. Simmer for 20 minutes until thickened.
Transfer mince mixture to an ovenproof dish.
Spread mashed potato over the top, creating peaks with a fork.
Bake at 200°C (180°C fan) for 25 minutes until golden.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of red wine to the meat mixture.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes well for up to 2 months. Can be cooked from frozen.
recipes.childFriendly: Children love the creamy mash topping! Make sure the meat is well-cooked and not too chunky.

recipes.name: Homemade Chicken Nuggets
instructions: Mix breadcrumbs with garlic powder and paprika.
Set up three bowls: seasoned flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumb mixture.
Coat each chicken piece in flour, egg, then breadcrumbs.
Place on a lined baking tray.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, turning halfway, until golden and cooked through.
recipes.adultsVariation: Make a spicy version with cayenne pepper in the breadcrumbs.
recipes.storageNotes: Freeze uncooked nuggets. Cook from frozen, adding 5 minutes to cooking time.
recipes.childFriendly: These are children's absolute favorite! So much better than shop-bought.

recipes.name: Sausage and Bean Casserole
instructions: Brown sausages in a large casserole dish. Remove and set aside.
Add onion to the dish, cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Stir in tomato purée, chopped tomatoes, stock, and herbs.
Return sausages to the dish, add beans.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat and cook for 30 minutes.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of balsamic vinegar or red wine for depth.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes well for up to 2 months.
recipes.childFriendly: children likes this with the sausages cut into small pieces. Very filling and comforting.

recipes.name: Easy Fish Pie
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and mash with 25g butter and 50ml milk.
Poach fish in 300ml milk for 8-10 minutes. Drain, reserving the milk. Flake fish into chunks.
Melt remaining butter in a pan, stir in flour to make a roux.
Gradually add the reserved milk, stirring constantly until thickened.
Add fish, prawns, peas, and parsley to the sauce. Transfer to an ovenproof dish.
Top with mashed potato, creating peaks with a fork.
Bake at 200°C (180°C fan) for 25-30 minutes until golden.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of white wine to the sauce or top with a cheese crust.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes well for up to 1 month.
recipes.childFriendly: children enjoys the creamy texture. Check carefully for any fish bones before serving.

recipes.name: Chicken Fajitas
ingredients: Grated cheese, sour cream, salsa to serve
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan over high heat.
Add chicken, cook for 5-6 minutes until nearly cooked.
Add peppers and onions, cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Sprinkle with fajita seasoning, toss well. Cook for 2 more minutes.
Warm tortillas according to package instructions.
Serve chicken mixture with tortillas and toppings.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add jalapeños, hot sauce, or extra seasoning for adults.
recipes.storageNotes: Chicken mixture keeps for 2 days. Reheat thoroughly before serving.
recipes.childFriendly: Children love making her own! Use mild seasoning and let her build her own fajita (with help).

recipes.name: Italian Meatballs in Tomato Sauce
instructions: Mix mince, half the onion, half the garlic, breadcrumbs, egg, and oregano in a bowl.
Brown meatballs in a large pan (you may need to do this in batches). Set aside.
In the same pan, cook remaining onion for 5 minutes. Add remaining garlic, cook for 1 minute.
Stir in tomato purée, tinned tomatoes, and stock.
Return meatballs to the pan, bring to a simmer.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add red wine to the sauce or serve with parmesan.
recipes.storageNotes: Freeze meatballs in sauce for up to 3 months.
recipes.childFriendly: children thinks these are fun! Make smaller meatballs for them portions.

recipes.name: Classic Roast Chicken Dinner
instructions: Rub chicken with 1 tbsp oil, herbs, salt, and pepper. Place in a roasting tin.
Toss potatoes and carrots with remaining oil, season, and arrange around chicken.
Roast for 90 minutes (or until juices run clear when thigh is pierced).
Remove chicken and vegetables, rest chicken for 10 minutes.
Make gravy using pan juices and gravy granules.
Carve chicken and serve with roast vegetables and gravy.
recipes.adultsVariation: Stuff the cavity with lemon and herbs for extra flavor.
recipes.storageNotes: Leftover chicken is perfect for sandwiches and meals throughout the week.
recipes.childFriendly: Children love roast chicken! Give them tender breast meat cut into small pieces.

recipes.name: Pork Chops with Apples
ingredients: Mashed potatoes and green beans to serve
instructions: Season pork chops with salt, pepper, and sage.
Heat oil in a large pan, cook chops for 4-5 minutes each side until golden. Remove and set aside.
Add butter to the pan, cook onion for 3 minutes.
Add apple slices, cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in stock, bring to a simmer.
Return chops to the pan, simmer for 5 minutes until cooked through.
Serve with mashed potatoes and green beans.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of cider or cream to the sauce.
recipes.storageNotes: Best eaten fresh. Leftovers keep for 1 day.
recipes.childFriendly: The sweet apples make this appealing to children. Cut the pork into small pieces for them.

recipes.name: Tuna Pasta Bake
ingredients: 2 x 160g tins tuna in spring water, drained
instructions: Cook pasta for 2 minutes less than package instructions. Drain.
Mix pasta with tuna, tomatoes, crème fraîche, sweetcorn, and oregano.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until bubbling and golden.
Serve with salad or garlic bread.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add chili flakes or capers for extra flavor.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes well for up to 2 months.
recipes.childFriendly: children enjoys the cheesy topping! Make sure tuna is well mixed in.

recipes.name: Mild Chicken Curry
ingredients: Rice and naan bread to serve
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan, cook chicken until browned. Remove and set aside.
Add onion, cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Add garlic and curry powder, cook for 1 minute.
Stir in tomatoes, coconut milk, and mango chutney.
Return chicken to the pan, simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve with rice and naan bread.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add extra curry powder, fresh chilies, or garam masala for adults.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes perfectly for up to 3 months. Freeze without rice.
recipes.childFriendly: Very mild and slightly sweet - perfect for children! They like it with plain rice.

recipes.name: Easy Beef Tacos
ingredients: Lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, sour cream to serve
instructions: Brown mince in a pan, breaking it up as it cooks.
Stir in taco seasoning and water.
Simmer for 10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Warm taco shells according to package instructions.
Serve with toppings and let everyone build their own tacos.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add jalapeños, hot sauce, or extra seasoning.
recipes.storageNotes: Meat mixture keeps for 2 days in the fridge.
recipes.childFriendly: Children love the interactive element! Use soft tortillas for them and mild seasoning.

recipes.name: One-Pan Chicken Traybake
instructions: Toss potatoes, peppers, and onion with 1 tbsp oil, half the paprika, and thyme in a roasting tin.
Make space in the center, place chicken thighs skin-side up.
Rub chicken with remaining oil and paprika, season with salt and pepper.
Roast for 45-50 minutes until chicken is golden and vegetables are tender.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add chili flakes or garlic for extra flavor.
recipes.storageNotes: Leftovers keep for 2 days in the fridge.
recipes.childFriendly: Easy meal with everything cooked together. Remove chicken skin for children if preferred.

recipes.name: Baked Salmon with Roasted Vegetables
ingredients: Couscous or new potatoes to serve
instructions: Arrange broccoli and tomatoes on a baking tray. Drizzle with 1 tbsp oil and season.
Place salmon fillets among the vegetables. Drizzle with remaining oil, lemon juice, and garlic.
Roast for 15 minutes until salmon is cooked through.
Serve with lemon zest sprinkled over and couscous or new potatoes.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add white wine, capers, or herbs to the roasting tray.
recipes.storageNotes: Best eaten fresh. Leftovers keep for 1 day.
recipes.childFriendly: Healthy and colorful! Check salmon carefully for bones before serving to children.

recipes.name: Classic Shepherd's Pie
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and mash with butter and milk.
Brown lamb mince in a large pan. Add onion and carrots, cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato purée, cook for 1 minute.
Add stock and Worcestershire sauce. Simmer for 20 minutes until thickened.
Transfer lamb mixture to an ovenproof dish.
Spread mashed potato over the top, creating peaks with a fork.
Bake at 200°C (180°C fan) for 25 minutes until golden.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of red wine or fresh rosemary to the lamb.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes well for up to 2 months.
recipes.childFriendly: Similar to cottage pie which Children love. Ensure the lamb is well-cooked and tender.

recipes.name: Chicken and Mushroom Pie
instructions: Cook chicken in a pan until browned
Stir in flour, then add stock and cream
Pour into pie dish, cover with pastry
recipes.childFriendly: Children love the creamy filling! Make sure the filling is not too hot before serving.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add white wine and fresh tarragon for extra flavor.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes well unbaked. Cook from frozen, adding 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Hearty Beef Stew
instructions: Stir in flour and tomato purée
recipes.childFriendly: Children enjoy the tender meat and vegetables. Cut into small pieces for younger children.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add red wine and herbs like thyme and rosemary.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes perfectly for up to 3 months.

recipes.name: Pork and Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Mix in soy sauce and honey
recipes.childFriendly: Sweet and savory flavors appeal to children. Use mild vegetables.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add ginger and chili for extra kick.
recipes.storageNotes: Best eaten fresh. Leftovers keep 2 days.

recipes.name: Fish Tacos with Slaw
instructions: Mix cabbage with mayo and lime juice
recipes.childFriendly: Interactive meal that children enjoy building. Use soft tortillas for easier eating.
recipes.storageNotes: Fish best eaten fresh. Slaw keeps 1 day.

recipes.name: Mild Lamb Curry
recipes.childFriendly: Mild curry suitable for children. Ensure lamb is tender and cut small.
recipes.adultsVariation: Increase spices and add fresh chili.

recipes.name: Chicken Quesadillas
instructions: Mix chicken with cheese and pepper
Cook in pan 2-3 minutes per side
recipes.childFriendly: Children love the cheesy filling. Cut into small wedges for easy eating.

recipes.name: Chicken Noodle Soup
recipes.childFriendly: Comforting and gentle on tummies. Perfect for children feeling unwell.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add fresh herbs like parsley and thyme.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes well without noodles. Add fresh noodles when reheating.

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and 1 tbsp paste
recipes.childFriendly: Mild and creamy version suitable for children. Ensure chicken is tender.
recipes.adultsVariation: Use hot tikka paste and add fresh ginger.

recipes.name: Chicken and Mushroom Risotto
recipes.childFriendly: Creamy and comforting. Children enjoy the soft texture.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add white wine and fresh herbs.
recipes.storageNotes: Best eaten fresh. Doesn't freeze well.

recipes.name: Chicken Schnitzel
instructions: Set up flour, egg, breadcrumb stations
Fry in oil 3-4 minutes per side
recipes.childFriendly: Crispy coating and mild flavor appeal to children. Cut into strips.
recipes.adultsVariation: Serve with potato salad and capers.
recipes.storageNotes: Best eaten fresh. Can refrigerate 1 day.

recipes.name: Classic Beef Lasagne
instructions: Make bolognese with mince, onion, garlic, tomatoes
recipes.childFriendly: Classic family favorite. Ensure it's not too hot before serving.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add red wine to bolognese and fresh basil.

recipes.name: Homemade Beef Burgers
instructions: Mix mince with onion, egg, seasoning
Grill or fry 4-5 minutes per side
recipes.childFriendly: Children love making their own burgers. Use mild seasonings.
recipes.storageNotes: Raw patties freeze well for 2 months.

recipes.name: Slow-Cooked Beef Casserole
recipes.childFriendly: Tender meat and vegetables. Perfect comfort food for children.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add red wine and worcestershire sauce.

recipes.name: Beef Stroganoff
instructions: Return beef, stir in sour cream
recipes.childFriendly: Creamy sauce appeals to children. Ensure beef is tender.

recipes.name: Classic Meatloaf
instructions: Mix all ingredients except 1 tbsp ketchup
Form into loaf shape in baking dish
recipes.childFriendly: Mild and familiar flavors. Slice thinly for children.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add herbs and serve with gravy.
recipes.storageNotes: Slices freeze well. Great for sandwiches.

recipes.name: BBQ Pork Ribs
instructions: Season ribs with paprika, salt, pepper
recipes.childFriendly: Sweet and sticky ribs children enjoy. Provide wet wipes!
recipes.adultsVariation: Add chili flakes to BBQ sauce.

recipes.name: Pork Meatballs in Tomato Sauce
instructions: Mix mince, half onion, egg, breadcrumbs
Make sauce with tomatoes, garlic, remaining onion
recipes.childFriendly: Fun shape and mild flavor. Make smaller meatballs for children.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add herbs like oregano and basil.

recipes.name: Pork Fried Rice
instructions: Cook pork in wok, set aside
recipes.childFriendly: Children enjoy the varied textures. Use day-old rice for best results.

recipes.name: Pork Schnitzel
instructions: Coat pork in flour, egg, breadcrumbs
Serve with lemon and potato salad
recipes.childFriendly: Crispy and mild. Children enjoy with ketchup.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Pulled Pork
instructions: Place in slow cooker with onions, garlic
recipes.childFriendly: Tender, easy to eat. Children love in buns or wraps.

recipes.name: Teriyaki Salmon
recipes.childFriendly: Sweet glaze appeals to children. Check for bones carefully.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add sesame seeds and spring onions.

recipes.name: Salmon Fish Cakes
instructions: Mix with mashed potato, spring onions, mayo
Coat in beaten egg and breadcrumbs
recipes.childFriendly: Familiar potato base makes these popular with children.

recipes.name: Tuna Pasta with Tomatoes
recipes.childFriendly: Simple and familiar. Omit olives for children if preferred.

recipes.name: Baked Cod with Chips
instructions: Toss with oil, bake 30 minutes at 200°C
Serve with lemon, peas, tartar sauce
recipes.childFriendly: Classic combination children enjoy. Check fish for bones.

recipes.name: Garlic Prawn Pasta
recipes.childFriendly: Mild and creamy. Ensure prawns are properly cooked.

recipes.name: Grilled Lamb Chops
instructions: Rub chops with garlic, oil, rosemary
recipes.childFriendly: Simple preparation. Ensure chops are not too fatty for children.
recipes.adultsVariation: Serve with mint sauce and red wine jus.

recipes.name: Irish Lamb Stew
recipes.childFriendly: Hearty and warming. Ensure lamb is very tender.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add pearl barley and worcestershire sauce.

recipes.name: Lamb Kofta with Flatbread
instructions: Mix lamb with spices, onion, garlic
recipes.childFriendly: Children enjoy making their own wraps. Use mild spicing.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add extra spices and serve with tahini.

recipes.name: Simple Moussaka
recipes.childFriendly: Rich flavors but children often enjoy this. Ensure it's not too hot.

recipes.name: Hearty Vegetable Soup
recipes.childFriendly: Nutritious and comforting. Blend smooth if children prefer.

recipes.name: Loaded Jacket Potatoes
ingredients: Various toppings: beans, tuna, chicken, coleslaw
recipes.childFriendly: Children love choosing their own toppings.

recipes.name: Creamy Mac and Cheese
instructions: Make roux with butter and flour
Top with breadcrumbs and remaining cheese
recipes.childFriendly: Ultimate children's favorite. Creamy and comforting.

recipes.name: Homemade Pizza
ingredients: Various toppings: pepperoni, ham, vegetables, chicken
recipes.childFriendly: Children love making their own pizzas with their favorite toppings.
recipes.adultsVariation: Try gourmet toppings like prosciutto and rocket.
recipes.storageNotes: Dough freezes well. Cooked pizza keeps 2 days.

recipes.name: Chicken Caesar Wraps
recipes.childFriendly: Easy to eat and customize. Children can help assemble.

recipes.name: Sticky Chicken Wings
recipes.childFriendly: Sweet and sticky. Provide plenty of napkins!

recipes.name: Chicken Burrito Bowls
recipes.childFriendly: Interactive meal children enjoy building.

recipes.name: Chicken Satay with Peanut Sauce
instructions: Mix peanut butter, soy, honey, lime
Serve chicken with sauce and rice
recipes.childFriendly: Children love peanut sauce. Check for allergies!

recipes.name: Chicken Parmesan
recipes.childFriendly: Cheesy and delicious. Children love this.

recipes.name: Mild Chicken Korma
instructions: Pour in coconut milk and cream
recipes.childFriendly: Very mild and creamy. Perfect for children.

recipes.name: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
recipes.childFriendly: Simple flavors. Ensure broccoli is tender.

recipes.name: Mild Beef Curry
recipes.childFriendly: Mild and suitable for children.

recipes.name: Pot Roast Beef
recipes.childFriendly: Tender and flavorful. Children enjoy with gravy.

recipes.name: Beef Kebabs
recipes.childFriendly: Fun to eat. Ensure beef is tender.

recipes.name: Beef Goulash
recipes.childFriendly: Rich and hearty. Ensure beef is very tender.

recipes.name: Pork and Apple Burgers
instructions: Mix pork with apple, onion, egg
recipes.childFriendly: Sweet and savory combination children enjoy.

recipes.name: Pork Noodle Stir-Fry
recipes.childFriendly: Children love noodles. Keep flavors mild.

recipes.name: Pork Tacos
recipes.childFriendly: Interactive meal. Use mild seasoning for children.

recipes.name: Roast Pork Tenderloin
recipes.childFriendly: Tender and slightly sweet. Children enjoy sliced thinly.

recipes.name: Salmon with Lemon Rice
instructions: Serve salmon on rice with peas
recipes.childFriendly: Light and healthy. Check salmon for bones.

recipes.name: Mediterranean Fish Stew
recipes.childFriendly: Rich flavors but mild. Ensure all bones removed.

recipes.name: Tuna Melt Toasties
recipes.childFriendly: Classic children's favorite. Cut into fingers.

recipes.name: Quick Prawn Curry
recipes.childFriendly: Mild and creamy. Ensure prawns cooked through.

recipes.name: Lamb and Mint Burgers
instructions: Mix lamb with mint sauce and onion
recipes.childFriendly: Flavorful but mild. Children may enjoy without mint.

recipes.name: Lamb Meatballs with Couscous
instructions: Mix lamb with cumin, breadcrumbs, egg
recipes.childFriendly: Fun shape. Use mild spicing for children.

recipes.name: Roast Leg of Lamb
instructions: Stud lamb with garlic and rosemary
recipes.childFriendly: Special occasion meal. Ensure meat is tender for children.
recipes.adultsVariation: Serve with mint sauce and red wine.

recipes.name: Chicken Enchiladas
instructions: Fill tortillas with chicken and cheese
recipes.childFriendly: Cheesy and mild. Children enjoy with sour cream.

recipes.name: Creamy Carbonara
recipes.childFriendly: Rich and creamy. Children love this pasta.
recipes.adultsVariation: Use guanciale and no cream for authentic version.

recipes.name: Ham and Cheese Quiche
recipes.childFriendly: Versatile meal children enjoy warm or cold.
recipes.adultsVariation: Try different fillings like mushroom and spinach.
recipes.storageNotes: Keeps 3 days. Serve cold or warm.

recipes.name: Vegetable Frittata
recipes.childFriendly: Light and nutritious. Children can help choose vegetables.

recipes.name: Easy Chicken and Prawn Paella
recipes.childFriendly: Colorful and exciting. Children enjoy the variety.

recipes.name: Meatball Sub Sandwiches
recipes.childFriendly: Fun to eat but can be messy. Provide napkins!

recipes.name: Chicken Chow Mein
recipes.childFriendly: Children love noodles. Keep ginger mild.

recipes.name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
recipes.childFriendly: Fun presentation. Children enjoy the pepper 'bowls'.

recipes.name: Creamy Pasta Primavera
recipes.childFriendly: Creamy and full of hidden vegetables.

recipes.name: Chicken Pot Pie
instructions: Make sauce with flour, stock, cream
recipes.childFriendly: Comfort food children love. Ensure filling is not too hot.

recipes.name: Salmon and Dill Cakes
recipes.childFriendly: Familiar potato base makes these popular.

recipes.name: Quick Pork Ramen
recipes.childFriendly: Children love the noodles. Adjust spice level.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add chili oil and authentic toppings.

recipes.name: Moroccan Lamb Tagine
recipes.childFriendly: Sweet and savory. Ensure lamb is very tender.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add more spices and preserved lemons.

recipes.name: Teriyaki Chicken Thighs
recipes.childFriendly: Sweet glaze children enjoy. Remove bones if preferred.

recipes.name: Loaded Beef Nachos
recipes.childFriendly: Fun and interactive. Children love building their plates.

recipes.name: Haddock and Potato Gratin
recipes.childFriendly: Creamy and comforting. Check fish for bones.

recipes.name: Sweet and Sour Pork
recipes.childFriendly: Sweet flavors appeal to children.
recipes.adultsVariation: Make homemade sauce with more tang.

recipes.name: Easy Chicken Fried Rice
recipes.childFriendly: Children love fried rice. Great way to use leftovers.

recipes.name: Bangers and Mash
instructions: Boil and mash potatoes with butter and milk
Serve sausages on mash with gravy and peas
recipes.childFriendly: Classic British comfort food children love.
recipes.adultsVariation: Use gourmet sausages and add onions to gravy.

recipes.name: Tuna and Tomato Rice
recipes.childFriendly: Simple one-pot meal children enjoy.

recipes.name: One-Pot Chicken and Orzo
recipes.childFriendly: One-pot meal children enjoy. Orzo is easy to eat.

recipes.name: Steak and Ale Pie
recipes.childFriendly: Rich and hearty. Children enjoy with mash.

recipes.name: Pork with Sauerkraut
instructions: Serve with boiled potatoes and mustard
recipes.childFriendly: Unique flavor. Some children may need encouraging!
recipes.adultsVariation: Add caraway seeds and white wine.

recipes.name: Mild Thai Green Curry
recipes.childFriendly: Mild version suitable for children. Adjust spice level.
recipes.adultsVariation: Use full-strength paste and add Thai basil.

recipes.name: Smoked Haddock Kedgeree
instructions: Stir in fish, eggs, butter, cream
recipes.childFriendly: Mild smoky flavor. Children enjoy finding the egg pieces.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add curry powder for traditional version.
